alert.note: Alert for Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 8:27PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster and central Dutchess Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 827 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Walden, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, Kingston, New Paltz, Ellenville, Rhinebeck, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Hurley, Highland, Millbrook, Modena, High Falls, Kerhonkson, Stanfordville, Tillson, Port Ewen, Fairview and Red Oaks Mill. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for east central New York.
